Reviews.Title: “Compact, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui O
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Mingle By The Park. The bed was big, the bathroom was clean and the air-con was fast and effective. It is only a 5 minute walk to the MTR (subway) and has a great variety of eating and market shopping places nearby. The Wifi was very good. It dropped out about once per day but only for a few minutes; otherwise it was very fast. We used to live in Hong Kong so were very used to the stair-well access to the road but honestly, one reviewer here said this was unsafe however HK is one of the safest / crime-free cities in the world so this really isn't an issue. I actually enjoyed the anonymity of coming and going as we pleased without the hotel staff seeing us. I only had one time I called front desk. I wanted to make a cup of tea but there was no sugar. They informed me the hotel doesn't supply sugar but then about 10 minutes later a porter knocked on the door with a few sachets of sugar. Having lived there we were also used to the compact way HK people can make a room. The only thing I thought was too small was the wash basin as you can't fully lean over the basin while brushing your teeth / shaving but in reality this is not really a big deal. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mingling in HongKong”
Reviews.Author: samanthalian87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mingle Place By The Park for 8 nights and thankfully i had prepared myself for the small living space (based on other trip advisors)! If you are a no-fuss traveller, on an average budget and intend on spending most of the day exploring the city then you won't complain. The location is perfect (right down the road from my favorite HK Style cafe) - Wanchai is my preferred area to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Ionut C
Reviews.Content: Well , I got to this hotel , by chance at all . I had some problems with my credit card and I have to spent the night somewhere , and not much cash so I choose this hotel only becasue of price . BUT , I the experince was nice . First I have to say that the room is preatty small , but if you are alone on business trip can be enough . The bath room si new and nice , and also the room si new and very comfortable bed . I slept very well . Please do not understand that is a 5 star hotel, I do think that you cannot spend more than 2-3 nights there . For the 500 HKS /night ( tax included ) I got a nice room , comfy bed , free wireless in the room !!! ( which i snot very common ) and good Location . So for me it was a nice surprise this hotel . If you just want somewhere to sleep this is a good-cheap choice . Also Flat TV in the room ! I stayed at 3 rd floor and I even had a small balcony . Interesting experince . I would recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Like in a Wong Kar-wai movie”
Reviews.Author: lil_volcano_girl
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something in Hong Kong which is almost impossible to find: that 1960s touch that is brilliantly staged in Wong Kar-wai movies. Tiny rooms, side by side long balconies that face the busy and bright streets which used to be the old harbor of Hong Kong. I found this all and more at the Mingle Place By the Park. The "more" stands for amazing shower (believe me, I needed after long flight connections and 2 weeks surfing in the Philippines), great location, and super friendly staff. Go to the park, located just behind the hotel, for a rest or walk - the park connects Wan Chai with Happy Valley. I couldn't think of a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!”
Reviews.Author: angela7
Reviews.Content: You might think this is a hotel, but it clearly states on the door of your room that in fact it is a guest house. Plus points, very helpful and friendly staff, from the cleaning ladies to the girls on the front desk and the polite and helpful manager Henry. They will help you with any questions you may have. Even the guys carting your luggage up those stairs are kind and don't complain. I must say the room was spotless, and cleaned extremely thoroughly every morning. The area is very interesting and it is handy for taxis, trams, etc. lots of little cafes and restaurants around. The restaurant adjoining the Mingle has wonderful and very fresh Chinese food...again, the staff are lovely. Negative point...room is absolutely minute! But I did have a little patio all to myself with table and chairs which made it more bearable. I do think it was overpriced, but then, you are on HK Island And HK is notorious for highly priced hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The park is a better alternative.”
Reviews.Author: Koenraad
Reviews.Content: People are nice here. That is true. But the rooms (I stayed in 203 and 405) are really, well, nòt nice. I started laughing when I entered my first room. Than I tried to touch the four walls at the same time. I could. Easily. I heard some rooms are better than others, so make sure you see the rooms before making a final reservation/ payment.

Reviews.Title: “Not even a hotel, more of a hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: I was mortified to arrive in the lobby and see a paper on the desk with all my confidential information of my credit card in plain view of anyone entering the lobby. The amount I was charged was over 100 dollars u.s. more than the quoted prices of the hotel lobby and the printed prices in the room. I made the reservation through booking.com that guarantees the lowest price and that was not the case. The hotel you arrive to is not where the room is. They take you up the elevator and up and down staircases and across a roof to an old apartment building to your room. It's a nightmare in the rain and with suitcases. Nothing like you imagine. The room was very tiny but clean. It should be listed as a hostel or apartment not a hotel. An extreme inconvienance to get to and from. I would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Brockinater
Reviews.Content: Pros: Convenient location Cheap price Free wi-fi Air-con Cons: Very, very hard, uncomfortable bed. No curtains on the windows and bright street lights. Eye mask was a necessity. Very thin walls, I could hear every time my neighbour received a text message. I could hear everything happening on the street. I could hear everyone who walked up and down the stairs. I could hear my drunk neighbours screaming in the corridor at 3am. Earplugs were a necessity. On my first night I received 2 automated wake up calls as well as another wake up call from the front desk staff between 2 am - 6 am. None of which I had booked. The front desk staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful. There was alot of mildew around the airconditioner which constantly dripped onto my pillows/head I would never stay here again nor would I ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small but serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Jazhel L
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Mingle by the Park in March 2012, and it is good for sleeping after a long day of work. For me, it's perfect since I'm back at 9pm and out by 7am. Plus points for a clean room, good quality sheets with 4 pillows, clean toilet with fresh towels daily, strong blast of cold air from the A/C, and global news channel are made available. I was pretty lucky to get the 5th floor as it's quieter and there is a lift that connects from Mingle by the Star, so i can use the lift and walk down one floor, pretty easy. Downside, the registration staff are not very friendly; but the porter/ welcome staff are very helpful with luggage and getting cabs. Can get a bit noisy with neighbors as the rooms are very compact. I would definitely stay at the Mingle again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisey”
Reviews.Author: Nik P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was refurbished in the past few months, and everything still appeared fresh and clean inside. There were two entrances to the hotel, one which looked like a residental house entrance, and a few door further along the street, there was another entrance that was far more trendy with lots of blue lighting and black reflective surfaces. The hotel was arranged within two adjoined buildings, but only one side had a lift, but even in the side without a lift (where I was staying), the staff were helpful with moving luggage in. All of the communal areas were clean and attractively presented, and there was also a business centre with computers and other business related bits and bobs. The room itself was clean and a resonable size. I had a double room, but the bed seemed a wee bit wider than a standard double. The bed was quite hard, but comfortable, and the (white) bed linens were flawlessly clean and totally unstained. There was also a DVD player and a LAN cable for the wired internet access. The ensuite bathroom was an acceptable size, and complimentary shaving and dental kits were provided along with the usual shampoos etc. One thing to mention however, is that the sink is very narrow and between two walls, so if you are blessed with the gift of shoulders and/ or arms, doing anything over the sink will be difficult (ie. shaving, washing your hands etc). Given the resonable price, I would have given the hotel a 5 star rating, however, it was very noisey at night. I was in a street facing room on the third floor, but the exterior wall onto the balcony is made of thin wood, and a lot of noise gets in. There is also a bus stop right outside the hotel, so that exacerbates the noise problem (the buses run until about midnight). Luckily, I appear to either enjoy listening to buses at night, or am a heavy sleeper, so the noise was not a big issue for me, but if it might be, a set of ear plugs should be packed.

Reviews.Title: “I tried swinging a mouse - fail”
Reviews.Author: geoff f
Reviews.Content: My fault for booking a cheap room for Honk Kong 7's weekend but I booked the single room with "balcony" for HKD1000/night....so not really that cheap! The bed was less than 6ft long, I'm 6'2". There was a pillar about 1ft square in the middle of the room so difficult to get into/out of/walk around the room. Couldnt sit on the toilet, no room for knee's. Walls were dirty, was a walk up 6 flights of stairs off the street, no leift on that part of the hotel. Anyone could walk up off the street, no security whatsoever. Stair well was recently plastered but no-one had bothered to paint it. The view of the squalid apartment block opposite the Wan Chai road was......different. The couple banging away in the room next door at 2am was a nice touch, as was charging HKD 22 for a can of coke.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the price you pay and for the convience of being quite central”
Reviews.Author: Egyptlove520
Reviews.Content: I was initially only going to stay for the one night, so booked the double value room online. I got quite a good deal, paying 425HK$ for the night. The room has a double bed that is wedged in between two walls, so not ideal if you are tall or claustrophobic. The bathroom was a good size and the complementary toiletries are always nice. I ended up having to stay another night but by that time i could only get the superior room. This worked out 725HK$, which is still cheaper than the 1500HK$ they will want if you book it through the hotel. The room was bigger with two single beds, although the bathroom was slighty smaller. If you think you will need to stay longer than the hotel check out at 12.00, i would book another night as it is 100HK$ every hour as a late check out fee. The good thing about the rooms is that each room has a large flatscreen TV, complete with english TV channels and a load of movies you can watch. The staff are generally friendly, the cleaning ones always greet you warmly. Some of the bad points: there is no lift, so you have to haul your luggage up from the first floor or down from the sventh floor, its up to you. Also if you get a room on the front of the hotel, its quite noisy with all the traffic paired with the balcony doors. I think its better to subsitute the window in a room for some peaceful sleep. A final point is the scuffed paint i had in my double value room. I don't know why every hotel room, apartment or office in china is painted white. The dirt and scuff marks show up very easily and are often not repainted for years. I really think as a hotel this should have been touched up. Overall a good value hotel if you can get the chepaer deals online and pretty central to everything on Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Solo Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Tarun G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for four days last week in a "Lite" room and thought it was excellent and perfect for my needs. I was in Hong Kong for work and needed to go to Convention Center which was only 10 minutes walking distance away. Needed a place to crash after a long day's work and it was perfect in location and price. The room, bathroom was very clean and the in-room entertainment of movies was very good! I will highly recommend this place to anyone who is travelling alone with not too much baggage (to walk up the stairs with) and would like to be centrally located in Hong Kong! Oh yes, if you are a light sleeper do avoid the rooms near Wan Chai road!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Zsuzsann
Reviews.Content: The location of this small place is great, you can walk around Wan Chai up to central Hong Kong area or take this cute old tram. I liked the way they furbished the rooms. They are really small, but enough for sleeping if you want to explore HK most of the time anyway. No breakfast included and it is pretty hard to find a good place around there to get a coffee+toast. The staff was not very helpful, we could check in online at the computer in the lobby, but were unable to get our boarding pass printed.

Reviews.Title: “Small but got all you need! Good for travellers with small baggages.”
Reviews.Author: W0ngJ
Reviews.Content: Very inexpensive room rate consider it is in a very convenient and centrally located place. The room is consider very small but if you only need an accommodation to have a good night rest, this is a place that can fullfil your particular need to rest after a long day sightseeing or busy activities. Of course, if you are thinking of a resort or a 5-stars hotel, this could be a wrong place. The only downside I could think of is about the stairways. So, it will be quite a heavy haul if you have big and heavy luggages.... It is recommended to travellers not to bring anything more than 1 carry on size luggage per person. Otherwise, this is a nice, clean and inexpensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Confused broom closet with the room”
Reviews.Author: Steveyinasia
Reviews.Content: Mingle on the Park defines the term bedroom, its a room you can only fit a bed in. Although the rooms are tastefully appointed, the space is tiny and there is no room for a place to rest your suitcase and no hanging space. I had the misfortune of getting a room facing Wan Chai road, the bus noise is unbearable making sleep almost impossible prior to midnight and after 6 am.....around the bus schedules. I would not recommend if you wish to be rested each morning. There is no elevator and I was on the fourth floor, this place does not have a gym, nor does it need one. The workout up the stairs, first day is harder with the suitcase, is enough to keep the heart pumping. Definitely not wheelchair friendly and even if there was a lift, you could not get a wheelchair in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and convenient -- a rarity in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: tmmahony
Reviews.Content: Mingle Place By the Park is a rarity in HK: cheap, clean, centrally-located and a decent place to stay. If you book on a last minute hotel website you can get rooms for about HK$400-500 (around US$50-60). The only other places in HK you can get prices anything like this are firetraps that you would not want to risk your life in. As well, the Mingle properties are all in old buildings that have been renovated with a certain amount of character and style, with pictures of old HK on the walls and tasteful tiles on the floors. They are also all completely high-tech with free wifi and a large movie library on demand. Now, you don't get all of this without some catches. The major one, of course, is room size. The rooms are tiny. I would advise against the "lite" rooms as they are really, really tiny. But the single rooms and above are livable (but if you are very tall then this probably is not the place for you). Basically, if all you want is a clean bed to sleep in, a good shower and free wifi in an excellent location, consider the Mingle. Also, you will have to carry your bags up several flights of stairs as they have no elevator. Again, this is a place for the solo traveler not planning on spending a lot of time in the room and without a lot of luggage. Mingle by the Place is in Wanchai, not far from the Wanchai computer center and convenient to MTR.

Reviews.Title: “All for the experience of a historical building”
Reviews.Author: ToniYuen
Reviews.Content: Funky makeover of a heritage building into boutique hotel. Extremely small rooms and no elevator, absolutely not for those with heavy luggage. Got great deal from asiawebdirect.com, hk$500 for double room. Tight space but very comfy bed. You may have to put up with noises from the busy streets; this is wan chai after all. Not your typical hotel, but rather fun to be in an old tenement house - for a great value too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: beneno
Reviews.Content: Good location, very close to MTR, good service, nice room with balcony. Room is small, but let's face it, it's Hong Kong. I've been in rooms much smaller there. The only drawbacks are that is has no elevator, my room was in the last floor and going up with luggage was a considerable effort, and that rooms face to the street so there is considerable noise.

Reviews.Title: “just not good enough”
Reviews.Author: Shanghaiscot
Reviews.Content: after arriving from a 13hr flight and then 40min taxi ride my colleague & I were looking forward to a good nights sleep & a hot bath. We arrived at the hotel and were stunned into slience, having stayed at many hotels over the years I have to say words failed me. The rooms were tiny, cramped & the noise of the cockroaches were audible. It was noisey both outside & inside the hotel, heaps of rubbish piled up outside the guestrooms, the internet connection straight outstide the door were other hotel guests were on U Tube for most of the night. No facilities, no service just a tiny horrid room so unsuitable for any business traveller needing down time. We booked in Wed 11pm & by Thur 7.30am we'd booked out 7 hours was more than enough....thankfully the lovely little Charter House Hotel a few blocks up the street had 2 rooms & a full suite of facilites for only $200HK extra...no roaches, no noise and excellent service. I WILL never Mingle anywhere again

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, kind of stylish, road noise, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EatSeeDo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the lite rooms; reminds me of microhotel I stayed in in Christchurch, NZ. Have to move slow.....or else you will bang elbows, knees against column, doors or other fixtures. Support column next to bed requires twisting to getting in/out. Bed is 6' long, wedged in between wall & window, no excess space... I'm only 5'10" so not a problem. Biggest catch is street noise, stayed on 4th floor overlooking busy 2 lane road with constant bus traffic...but atleast HK drivers don't honk unlike those at home in NYC....should really replace french style doors w/something more sound proof...resorted to ear plugs. Should repaint white walls with darker color....scuffs all over but that's minor aesthetic point to me. Employee helped me carry bag down stairs post checkout, i was impressed by this compensation for lack of elevator, but i did lug bags up myself at check in. I enjoyed the stylish touches even if some of it has faded. Techy media system a little confusing to use. Staircase was well maintained & look pleasant but there's no front door at street. Bathroom was fine, no issues. Stayed at Mingle Wing 2 weeks ago, roomier but shower issues on 12th floor (kept alternating between hot/cold)...also excellent location. Designer clearly gave much thought to how the hotel is set up.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget option but it's definitely no frills”
Reviews.Author: Clychan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The pros are that (1) the hotel is very cheap by Hong Kong standards (my HK friend thought the single room with balcony for less than HK$600 a night was possibly the best deal in the city); (2) it's clean and (3) it's well-located in Wanchai which has plenty of eateries and public transport options. It's only a short tram/MTR ride to Central and Causeway Bay. The cons are that (1) there is minimal service and the hotel has no lifts so be prepared to lug luggage and shopping up a few flights of stores; (2) there was construction going on while I was there and it started every morning at 8am which made it difficult to sleep in past that time; (3) the room was the smallest I had ever been in my life (and I lived in HK for 18 months) which I don't think would suit people used to Western-sized houses or apartments and (4) the airconditioning leaked a bit so I had to stagger the use of the airconditioning. I'm trying JJ's Hotel for another upcoming trip to Hong Kong (it's slightly more expensive) but if JJ's hadn't been available I would probably have returned to this hotel but this time would have booked a double room.

Reviews.Title: “Really small room, but really good value for HK”
Reviews.Author: seanfrom
Reviews.Content: Try and find a decent hotel in HK for HKD$350 on HK Island.. this is it! Wifi works well. If you are going to complain about the really small rooms, stay at a more expensive hotel. It's Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “No elevator and drag your bags 6 floors to a WALK IN CLOSET”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysondroad
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler through Hong Kong and stay often in Wanchai. Because I had never stayed at Mingle by the Park I thought I would give it a chance. Problem is the travel company that I booked the hotel through did not make it clear that there was: No clear sign that you are going to the right place. No Elevator. Narrow Stairway No Doorman. No reception. And when you finally get into your room you find it is more like a walk in closet with a bed fit for a king MIDGET! Seriously . . . the bed was only 6 feet long. 15 years of producing furniture for hotels and resorts around the world . . . and the industry standard for king and queen is 80" (Thank goodness my girlfriend did not go to Hong Kong with me this trip. . . I had to sleep diagonally). After dragging all four of my bags blindly up to the 1st floor (They are counting the ground floor as Zero so it makes staying on the 5th floor seem better), I was coldly greeted by two girls behind the counter. After going through the credit card thing, I found out my room was 502 Broom Closet extrodinare (6th floor). Having Arthritis in my feet, I complained about the high floor and no elevator and asked about what I could do with my bags that I did not need, few seconds later I was heaving them to the 6th floor. When I arrived to the top. . the door ways to the rooms were difficult to enter and the door knob would not turn. I returned downstairs to have one of the girls open the room. After climbing the stairs again, I was shocked when I got into the room and saw a bed jammed in between 3 walls and a room that would make a submariner closterfobic. When I questioned the receptionist about the bed for 2 (Double bed) she said this is their standard size (NOT ACCORDING TO THE IMAGES ON THEIR WEBSITE). Which they do claim is "is perfectly suited to the needs of the business traveller, served by the latest technology, services and devices." Well I took pictures: - Bed - 72" x 48" - Mirror hidden behind bathroom door - Sink 8" diameter basin with textured glass behind it (No mirror behind it). - there was a refrigerator and hot water heater - the clock in the room was analog and clicked all night - there was a TV and Air Conditioning . . . but could not find the remotes. - there was NO balcony (Like so many others talk about on this site) - the shower was so small but they did have hot water and good water pressure. . . - the soaps they put in bathroom were in hard shampoo bottles and difficult to get out. - the internet was worthless, I spent 2 hours trying to download email (I stayed on a Sunday night without much incoming email). When I checked out. . . same two girls were at the counter. I told them that I felt cheated and that Mingle By the Park misrepresents their rooms by showing photos rooms with real sized beds. I guess they have heard this many times before as they did not care. If you feel energetic and don't need any service . . . this could be a good place . . . but if you are a business person . . . STAY AWAY from this place. . .

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for solo backpacker / traveller - No frills but perfect !”
Reviews.Author: JHK2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this 'hotel' for 4 nights in May 2010. It was a tiny little room on the 3rd floor (no lift so was a bit tricky up several flights of very narrow stairs with lotsof luggage!) The entrance to the hotel itself is sandwiched between a Chinese health shop and I think it was an opticians. It it so small you would miss it if you didn't know it was there!!. It was however perfect for what I needed. A bed and a shower for a few nights. It had a TV and free Wifi which was great given thatI only paid the equivalent of about 25/30 GBP per night! The bathroom was the smallest room ever and the sink was hilarious, around 6 inches wide between 2 walls with a mirror over the sink - you could only squeeze one shoulder in at a time to see in the mirror, but its all part of the HK charm! The bed stretched from one side of the room to the window, with just a few cm's spare to get in and out. Its exactly as it says on their website and really cute for a solo traveller. Perfectly situated on the MTR, bus and tram lines. Noisy as it is on the main Wanchai to Central road - but you know what youre booking when you look it up so it wasn't a problem to me. I used to live in HK so I knew it would be like this given the fact it was on the busiest road ever !! It also had the smallest balcony in the world. Standing room only ! I just loved this place Staff were very friendly and kept my luggage in their tiny recption on the last day so I didnt have to drag it round with me. given this is far more like a hostel than a hotel I was impressed with the staff and the Wifi for the money. I would recommend it and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Smallest "room" I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: pomozki
Reviews.Content: The hotel called my room a "lite room" - lite on the truth would be more accurate! Calling mine a room is false advertising - it was more like a rabbit-hole. I tried to measure it and judging by my body (I'm 1.74m tall), it was about 2m x 3.5m = 7 square meters. Try and picture that. What's more, there was a big structural pillar right by my bed, making it hard to even get in and out of bed. In the tiny space that was mine they somehow managed to fit a TV (fixed to the wall at the end of the bed), an ensuite bathroom, a wall cabinet for tea/coffee and kettle/jug etc - and a balcony of about 1 square meters that was good only for looking down at the street. It might have been a feat of design but it was a horrible experience. Location was good for Wan Chai and going to Chinese Embassy for my visa renewal but even for $375 HK dollars, it was poor beyond words.

Reviews.Title: “"It's So Cute I Wanna Die!!!" Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lindaa78
Reviews.Content: It's a gorgeous little hotel in the busy centre of Wanchai. It is true what the other reviewers say about the size. It has tiny rooms but they are so quaint and cute. I had the single room while my parents took the Queen Double Room. I had a pleasant surprise when my single room led out to my own private garden with garden bench which we used it in the mornings for breakfast. We would buy the local delights from the neighbourhood and enjoy it in the private garden. Plus points: - Quaint, historical boutique hotel with an interesting concept. Read all about it in the tourist kit in the room. Tourist kit also had great tips for visiting major tourist spots. - Clean & thoughtful with their toiletries - Helpful service staff - Great location. Close to MTR station. - The hotel has a huge collection of free movies on your 'smart' tv system. To unwind after a day of shopping/sightseeing, I unwound by watching all 3 series of Ip Man (very appropriate themed movie being in HK) :) - Free Wifi Minus points: - Small bathroom space - Small in general - Noisy (if you are facing the main road. I fared better as my room was at the back of the hotel so it was virtually noise-free at night, while my parents had to put up with some traffic at night. However it was bearable) Overall, a pleasant stay. I will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Noise pollution + A/C issues”
Reviews.Author: BoydJones
Reviews.Content: On the good side, I have been told that other Mingle hotels in Hong Kong are great. However, there is not consistent brand quality level between hotels apparently. Although the location in Wanchai was convenient and the hotel (old, old apartments renovated) was well decorated, the negative factors overwhelmed the positive making this one of the worst hotel stays in my life. The problems included: * Not clear that the reception office was on the 1st floor (2nd floor up to Americans) and I lugged my suitcase up too many stairs. * That is to say, no elevator. * The first room I was placed into (Room 401) had NO working air conditioner in the tropical, Mississippi-like heat of a Hong Kong summer! * Worst of all, the paper-thin walls let in ALL the sounds from the street -- people, cars, buses rumbling past, etc. The only way I could get any sleep was to stuff my ears with earplugs (thank goodness I had brought some with me).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: james_yorks
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed in this hotel I was very impressed with the price I paid for the hotel as well as the standard of a lite-room (small en-suite room for single traveller). The room was really well kitted out and for the price I don’t think you could bet it. Yes the room was tiny but then I was only using it as a base for a couple of nights to sleep and get showered etc. The en-suite room was very clean with nice free toiletries Location is fantastic on Hong Kong Island and only takes 2 mins walk from the underground train station and great place to explore from. As mentioned before this hotel would not be suitable for people that can’t walk up flights of stairs as it does not have a lift.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: rocco85
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel to stay in, however it does not compromise on quality. This hotel is in a excellent location, the room was spotless and while small provided everything I needed for a stay in Hong Kong. I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Heritage Shophouse Hotel but newly renovated at bustling & convenience Wan Chai”
Reviews.Author: limteoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the center of busting Wanchai Road, one of the oldest parts of Hong Kong. The location is right in the centre of all amenities, shops, food outlets, and markets. It is within walking distance to bars and red lights district, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre , harbours with trams criss-cross the area…. This hotel is newly renovated, so everything works - showers, toilets, lights, air-con. The place is clean, walls freshly painted white. Room is small typical of Hong kong primed real estate but good enough for two beds and two adults . Comfortable. But, since it is located in narrow shophouse beside busy street, with street activities down below, it is a bit noisy during the day but die down towards the night. The windows should have been double-glazed but it is good to experience the Wanchai atmosphere which include the noises of buses, cars, people, business activities but peaceful enough at night. The young people at the counter are polite and helpful. During my stay, I left behind a small bag but they took the trouble to prepare them to be sent back. All in all, the place is convenience, value for money and everything works!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Queen Double Room - Worse than a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: LifeInAsia
Reviews.Content: Pros - cosy and cute hotel theme - staff was pleasant to deal with - convenient location, not far from Wanchai subway and close to Causeway Bay too! - free internet Cons - way too small for two adults - lots of luggage? forget this place - All towels I received were ripped and very abused ones. Makes me wonder if they are mixing floor mats with body towels - stayed for 6 days, and they didn't change sheets!!! I know because I killed a fruit fly on the edge of the sheet on the first day, and the stain was there all throughout my stay - there was construction going on....and the room smelled like paint all day and night - the "tea water" heating pot couldn't even fit enough hot water to fill an instant noodle bowl - you can hear the noise from the cars outside quite loudly in the room I paid about USD 110 per night and I heard them quoting others USD 140 per night. Granted it was during the Asian Games.....still, compared to a Motel 6 in the states, i don't think this place is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “a quiant budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Luna_Shin
Reviews.Content: Mingle by the Park is a nice little budget hostel...and budget being the operative word, it is understandable that you'll get a small room, especially in a country like HK where there isn't a lot of space. Stayed at their Double Value Room with my husband...and I got to give it to the hotel management who made wise use of the limited space. By the way, the double value room is inside the business center. Fortunately, we didn't experience any noise from those who use the free internet. Thumbs-up on: * The bathroom! Nice lighting and the basic bath toiletries are complete * The comforter which helped me sleep through the cold November air * The room -- which is small and cosy, just right for a married couple on a budget * The front desk personnel especially Kiko and Josephine who's always smiling and attentive to our request *The location - walking distance to mtr, hk convention center, bus stops, street markets but since this is along a major thorough-fare, you can expect street noise which promptly fades away as soon as the clock strikes 12... Thumbs down on: * The noise from the construction downstairs! Fortunately, the work is from 10AM to 6PM the time when we are out touring but we needed to sleep on our first day in HK (coming from an early flight) and the noise made it hard for me to get some sleep * TV channels - very limited! was looking for CNN but couldn't find it! ...but then again, I did not go to HK to watch tv, so this is ok Again, remember this is a no-frills, budget hotel. Gets the job done for those looking for a place to stay, sleep, take a bath and rest...without having to pay big bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller than a prison cell but very clean - great for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: DogDoggyDog
Reviews.Content: Fanny, the owner of this hotel is a space logostic genius, what she's been able to pack into a space smaller than a prison cell is brilliant. Her biggest obstacle was a support beam right i the middle of the tiuny room, biut she's managed to get around this, by installing only a single bed on one side of the beam. The only problem is that you can't lay completely open a normal size big suitcase, the beam gets in the way. If you are intending ti be out and about most of the time, this is perfect for you. Excellent Wi-Fi (WLAN), very clean, great location etc. They ven have a helpful doorman and twenty four hour desk. No frills, but you can get rooms for as little as 300 HK. That's about 27 Euro. I booked through WOTIF dot COM. You are right in the middle of HK, causeway Bay with Sogo and Times Spare a couple of minutes by tram one way and Central a few minutes the other way. Ver close to the 298 computer center on Hennessy Rd, see if you can guess the number. There is a Veg Restaurant at 241 Hennessy Rd that vegheads should not miss, actually, meat eaters will like it as well, Very extensive menu. Look up HappyCow.net for full veg guide. If you are traveling light, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Service is extremely terrible.”
Reviews.Author: malikhkok
Reviews.Content: I was currently live in Macau and I stayed at this hotel at 2 Oct 2009. However, when I back to Macau I received my credit card bill which show me that they chared me an additional fee HKD65. When I e-mail them and they notified me that they forgot to release my credit card and they promise to transfer the money back to my China Bank Account. However, they told me the bank will charge them HKD220 service charge. So. they said they will send me the money by post. Now, I have already settled my credit card bill and I really want to get my money back though it's just a small amount of money. I think this is not fair! Until this moment, I haven't received my money yet and I keep sending them e-mails (more than 10 e-mails already)ask them to follow up this issue. But what I feel is that they are just playing me around but not correct their staff''s fault immediately! I will highly appreciate if here's any managers or somebody from this hotel investigate this issue. This IS NOT SERVICE from any hotels they suppose to treat their guest. I feel absolutely and extremely disappointed with this hotel and I will NEVER return again. Word of mouth for hotels is very important. I hope they can do what should they do immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel with very old style”
Reviews.Author: carolzero
Reviews.Content: Is not a bad hotel if you can walk up and down 5 floors everytime... the room is small, no place to put my suitcase or my bag... room and toilet is clean... staff is friendly... don't expect room service with budget hotel~~~ the location isn't exactly close to the MTR... it will take about 10 mins walk... the worst part is the stairs... if u are on high floor u, it could kill u... but if u are near the reception floor... lots of noise from people coming in and out... this hotel is just ok as the price is low... what do u expect~

Reviews.Title: “hotel for the thrifty and petite =)”
Reviews.Author: jcahyumae
Reviews.Content: we stayed at another hotel while other friends stayed here at mingle by the park. i should say that the entrance was barely noticeable with all the stores lines up at the same street and their name sign was not helpful at all. the entry way was immediately the small narrow staircase leading up to the business centre and lobby on the second floor. the walls weren't even painted, it was just bare cement with bathroom-like tiled stairs. but the upper floors had some wallpapers already. the staircases were equipped with fire extinguishers and decorated by a couple of picture frames. yes no elevators but it wasn't a long plight to the next floor. it could create a problem when you have big and heavy luggage and you are at the upper floors. the rooms were really small and there wasn't much space for big luggage. the sink and mirror was outside the bathroom, it was on the same table as the tv. the bed occupied most of the space in the room, the space is fine but when you get to shop and get more things, it could get really cramped. the best thing about mingle is their business centre, they have 2 laptops with high speed internet access and its free. it also has a tv, a desk with tea and newspapers. i've also noticed that there were still guest rooms inside the business centre, so its probably not a good thing to stay in those rooms for it could get noisy any time with all the guests using the internet. the location is great though, its accessible to everything, from groceries to shops, tram and subway, its all within minutes walk. mingle is a good place for people on a budget and petite. =p the staff was nice and friendly. =)

Reviews.Title: “Packs a lot into a small space”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior7000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the "lite" room which has a narrow single bed - this would be cramped for tall guests. Value for money was good: the room fitted a lot in a small space and seemed brand new. The hotel is about 5-10 mins walk from Wanchai MTR on Johnston Rd. There are eateries, shopping centres and convenience stores nearby. The entrance was extremely difficult to find. It's just a narrow entrance leading onto stairs with a small sign - it's in the middle of a row of shops. I doubt if taxis would know it as it's new and not very visible. There is a small road alongside that leads onto Wanchai Park. Across the road the building is easy to spot as it's only 4-5 stories high, a lot shorter than the surrounding buildings. The room itself is tiny - possibly the smallest I've ever stayed in! Use of space was ingenious with a mini bar fridge, tea/coffee area, pull out desk and wardrobe all in a small alcove. There's also an LCD TV over the bed and aircon. The bathroom is a good size considering. The only awkwardness was a lack of space for my suitcase - I pushed it towards the balcony door where it was mostly out of the way. WiFi is included and was of good quality with good signal strength. The TV has a good selection of English-speaking cable channels as well as local free to air channels. There was no lift and the security/door man is available to help bring suitcases up and down. I stayed on level 2 so it was just a short walk up and down: probably faster to get in and out than many hotels with their busy lifts. The room also featured a very small balcony, facing onto Wanchai Rd. The building is a renovated 1960s block of flats and there are some nice design touches as well as comprehensive booklet introducing guests to traditional life in these apartments (as was). One downside is that Wanchai Rd is very busy with noisy buses zooming up and down til about midnight. If you're a light sleeper the early morning garbage collection might wake you up too.
